name: Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA)
description: The Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA) is South Africa’s market conduct regulator for financial institutions. Established under the Financial Sector Regulation Act, it oversees the fair treatment of financial customers, enforces conduct standards, and promotes market integrity. The FSCA succeeded the Financial Services Board (FSB) in 2018 and supervises entities offering banking, insurance, retirement, and forex trading services.

meta.title: The FSCA: South Africa’s Forex Watchdog and Your Trading Safety Net

bottomline: The FSCA isn’t perfect—its lack of a compensation fund and slow ODP rollout are real concerns. Yet it’s transformed South Africa into Africa’s most structured forex hub, where traders can access global markets with enforceable rights. As algorithmic trading and crypto CFDs explode, expect tighter FSCA scrutiny on price manipulation and AI ethics.
